cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENTPrinted for the War Cabinet. December 1944.SECRET: Copy No.W.M. (44)175th Conclusions; ^WAR CABINET 175 (44).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held at 10 Downing Street,S.W. 1, on Friday, 29th December, 1944, at 6 p.m.Present:The Right Hon. Winston S. Churchill, M.P., Prime Minister (in the Chair)The Right Hon. C. R. Attlee, M.P., The Right Hon. Anthony Eden, M.P.,Lord President of the Council. Secretary of State for Foreign: Affairs. .The Right Hon. Ernest Bevin, M.P., The Right Hon. Oliver Lyttelton,Minister of Labour and National j M.P., Minister of Production.Service.The Right Hon. Lord Woolton,Minister of Reconstruction.The following were also present:The Right -Hon. A. V. Alexander,M.P., First Lord of the Admiralty.The Right Hon. Lord Cherwell,Paymaster-General.Admiral of the Fleet Sir andrew cunningham, First Sea Lord and chief of Naval Staff.The Right Hon. Sir archibald sinclair, Bt., M.P., Secretary ofState for Air.The Hon. Sir Alexander Cadogan,Permanent Under-Secretary of Statefor Foreign Affairs.Marshal' of the Royal Air force sir Charles F. A. Portal, Chief ofthe Air Staff.Lieutenant-General Sir ArchibaldNye, Vice-Chief of the ImperialGeneral Staff.. Secretariat :Sir Edward Bridges.General Sir Hastings L. Ismay.Sir Gilbert Laithwaite.Greece. The Prime Minister and the Secretary of- State for Foreign(Previous Affairs gave the War Cabinet an account of their visit to AthensEeference: . and of the conversations which had taken place there. A record of w.M. (44) 174th the discussion and of the conclusions reached is kept in theConclusions, Secretary's Standard File of War Cabinet Conclusions.Minute 8.) ' .Offices of the War Cabinet, S.W.1,29th December, 1944.
